title: Armenian Style Lentil Soup
description: A hearty soup with lentils, mint, and parsley — a Shehirian family classic.
steps: Boil lentils in water for 15 minutes.
Add onion, parsley, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 45 minutes.
Add mint and butter. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add 1/4 tsp. pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Optional: Fry butter until light brown and pour over soup.

title: Royal Soup
description: A lemony meatball soup with rice and parsley, inspired by Middle Eastern flavors.
steps: Mix raw meat, bulghur wheat, onion, parsley and seasoning together and shape into 1" diameter balls.
Add rice to the meat balls mixture.
Add meat balls to hot chicken broth and simmer until cooked through.
Add lemon juice and celery. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add salt and lemon slices. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Adjust sourness, saltiness, or thickness with sugar, water, or rice as needed.
Pour broth over meatballs and serve.

title: Scotch Broth
description: A traditional Scottish soup made with lamb, root vegetables, and barley — warm and filling.
steps: Simmer lamb in stock for 1 hour, skimming off any foam.
Add barley and cook for 30 minutes.
Add chopped vegetables and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.
Remove lamb, shred meat, and return to pot.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley and serve hot.
